conclusion: Internal energy U is a function of temperature only for an ideal gas.
States a and c are connected by two adiabatic branches.
Along any adiabatic expansion, the temperature decreases.
State c is at the top of the first adiabatic curve and the gas expands to reach state a, so Tc > Ta.
Since U ∝ T, larger temperature at state c means internal energy is larger than at state a.
